snippet: The disease-carrying pest appears to spread along highways in Panama, suggesting that spraying cars and trucks could combat the mosquito.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS Neglected Tropical Diseases finds that Asian tiger mosquito, which carries dengue and chikungunya viruses, is spreading along highway routes by hitching rides on vehicles; finding carries implications for disease control.
lead_paragraph: The disease-carrying pest appears to spread along highways in Panama, suggesting that spraying cars and trucks could combat the mosquito.

headline.print_headline: Mosquitoes in Panama Travel the Highways
headline.main: Study Suggests Way to Fight Asian Tiger Mosquito
